notes.text:
Salting eggplant removes bitterness
Let rest 15 minutes before cutting
Even better the next day

steps.descr: Salt and drain eggplant slices for 30 minutes

on_enter.say: Right, let's start by salting the eggplant slices to draw out any bitterness. We'll let them drain for 30 minutes.

steps.instructions: Salt and drain eggplant slices for 30 minutes

steps.descr: Grill or fry eggplant until golden

on_enter.say: Now, let's get those eggplant slices nice and golden. You can grill or fry them until they're beautifully browned.

steps.instructions: Grill or fry eggplant until golden

steps.descr: Make meat sauce: brown lamb, add onion and tomatoes, simmer

on_enter.say: Right, let's get cracking on the meat sauce. Brown the lamb, then add the onion and tomatoes. Let it all simmer until it's rich and lovely.

steps.instructions: Make meat sauce: brown lamb, add onion and tomatoes, simmer

steps.descr: Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, whisk in milk

on_enter.say: Let's whip up a creamy béchamel sauce. Melt the butter, stir in the flour, and then whisk in the milk until it's smooth and thick.

steps.instructions: Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, whisk in milk

on_enter.say: Now for the fun part! Let's layer the eggplant and meat sauce in your baking dish. Repeat until all the ingredients are used up.
Let's finish it off by topping with that lovely béchamel and a generous sprinkle of Parmesan. It's going to be gorgeous!

steps.descr: Bake at 180°C for 45 minutes until golden

on_enter.say: Time to bake our masterpiece! Pop it in the oven at 180°C for 45 minutes until it's golden and bubbling.

steps.instructions: Bake at 180°C for 45 minutes until golden

recipe.title: Moussaka
recipe.description: Layered Greek casserole with eggplant, meat sauce, and béchamel
